items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message: The Western Rother at Fittleworth is still high, but continues to slowly fall. Minor flood impacts in the area, affecting fields, gardens and rural roads, should begin to slowly ease. River levels should return to near normal in Fittleworth, by Thursday 12/08/2021. In Liss, Sheet, Iping, Midhurst and Lodsbridge near Selham, river levels have already returned to normal. The weather forecast predicts high pressure and no more than 1 or 2 mm of rain for the next five days, and therefore very little flood risk in the week ahead. However, the ground is now a lot wetter than normal for the time of year. Any future rainfall events in the coming weeks are likely to generate a response from the river. We will continue to monitor the river levels and forecast and will re-issue this message if the risk of flooding could return.

The Cuckmere River is now slowly falling through Alfriston, following Monday morning's heavy rain. Minor flood impacts of water in fields will remain for the next couple of days. No new flooding is expected in the next 5 days as the weather forecast predicts no rain in the period to Sunday. The dry weather will allow river levels to continue to fall in Alfriston, perhaps returning to more normal levels by Friday 13/08/2021. River levels in Hellingly are already much lower than at their peak Monday. However, the ground is now a lot wetter than normal for the time of year. Any future rainfall events in the coming weeks are likely to generate a response from the river. We will continue to monitor the river levels and forecast and will re-issue this message if the risk of flooding could return.
